skill.name: human-docs-generator
skill.description: Generates role-based human documentation (<1000 words per doc). Use when epics complete, breaking changes occur, or architecture decisions are made. Creates guides for developers, QA, DevOps, and business stakeholders.

skill.author: Brownbull

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill definition with no executable code. This SKILL.md file only contains YAML frontmatter and Markdown documentation describing the skill's behavior. No network calls, filesystem access, command execution, or environment variable access.

content.value_statement: Complex AI-generated code and architecture decisions need clear documentation that different team members can understand. This skill transforms technical state into simple, role-specific guides for developers, QA, DevOps, and business stakeholders.
actual_capabilities: Generates role-specific documentation for developers, QA, DevOps, architects, product managers, and end users
Creates diagrams using Mermaid.js syntax for component trees, API flows, and user journeys
Triggers documentation updates on epic completions, breaking changes, or architecture decisions
Maintains living documents under 1000 words per document with quickstart guides and examples
limitations: Requires ai-state directory structure to exist in the project
Cannot generate screenshots or visual assets beyond Mermaid diagrams
Depends on having sufficient context in operations.log and task files
Cannot update documentation outside the ai-state/human-docs/ directory

use_cases.title: Document Architecture Decisions
use_cases.description: Generate system design documentation and patterns for new team members and stakeholders.

use_cases.title: Onboard New Developers
use_cases.description: Create quickstart guides and component maps that help new developers understand the codebase.

use_cases.title: Track Feature Roadmaps
use_cases.description: Generate feature documentation and metrics summaries for business stakeholders.

prompt_templates.title: Generate All Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate human docs for all roles (developers, QA, DevOps, product managers) based on recent changes in ai-state/active/ and ai-state/knowledge/. Include Mermaid diagrams for component relationships.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Developer Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a frontend-developer.md guide showing component hierarchy, state management patterns, and recent UI changes. Use Mermaid graphs.

prompt_templates.title: Generate End User Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Create end-user-guide.md with step-by-step instructions, workflow diagrams, and screenshots descriptions for new features.

prompt_templates.title: Update Architecture Docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Update architect.md with new patterns, system design changes, and decision logs from ai-state/knowledge/decisions.md.

best_practices: Trigger documentation generation immediately after epic completion while context is fresh
Include Mermaid diagrams to reduce reading time and improve comprehension
Keep each document under 1000 words focusing on current state, not history
Verify generated documentation works by testing the described steps
anti_patterns: Writing changelogs instead of current-state documentation
Including technical deep-dives meant for other developers
Using walls of text without bullets, diagrams, or examples
Assuming prior knowledge and skipping explanations

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works as a prompt-based skill definition.

faq.question: How often should documentation be generated?
faq.answer: Generate on epic completion, breaking changes, or architecture decisions. Not on every small task.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, trigger via events when deployments complete. Documentation can be committed alongside code changes.

faq.question: Is my project data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Safe. This skill only reads from the local ai-state directory and generates markdown output. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why is documentation limited to 1000 words?
faq.answer: Shorter documents have higher completion rates. Use diagrams and examples to convey complex information efficiently.

faq.question: How is this different from auto-generated API docs?
faq.answer: This skill creates human-centric guides for different roles, not API reference docs. It includes workflows, diagrams, and context.
